entry.title: No mtg - go to Richard Sproat's talk!
entry.summary: Hi all! We won't be meeting this week, since Richard Sproat will be giving a talk at 2pm in theCenter for Global Studies and Human Development, as part of theAmerican International Morphology Meeting (AIMM). Sproat is one of the pioneers of computational morphology and a leading expert of …
entry.content:
Hi all! We won't be meeting this week, since Richard Sproat will be giving a talk at 2pm in theCenter for Global Studies and Human Development, as part of theAmerican International Morphology Meeting (AIMM). Sproat is one of the pioneers of computational morphology and a leading expert of the field.

The abstract for the talk, titled "40 Years of Work in Computational Morphology," can be found here.

Hope to see you there!!

entry.title: Alëna & Ayla on tracking morphological changes in Shakespeare's works
entry.summary: Hi all! At tomorrow's meeting (4/26) Alëna and I will be presenting our methodology and results for tracking morphological changes across Shakespeare's early and later works, as the spellings in these are texts are inconsistent by virtue of being from a time before English orthography became standardized. Hope to …
entry.content: Hi all! At tomorrow's meeting (4/26) Alëna and I will be presenting our methodology and results for tracking morphological changes across Shakespeare's early and later works, as the spellings in these are texts are inconsistent by virtue of being from a time before English orthography became standardized. Hope to see you there!

entry.title: Subregular Workshop!
entry.summary: Hi all! The week of Subregular Workshop is upon us. From April 18-20 the Computational Phonology Workshop will be held, overlapping with our weekly meeting. Topics include fixed point logics, subregular formal languages, transductions with logic and automata, algorithmic learning, and phonological phenomena (harmony, stress, optionality, and more). It is …
entry.content:
Hi all! The week of Subregular Workshop is upon us. From April 18-20 the Computational Phonology Workshop will be held, overlapping with our weekly meeting. Topics include fixed point logics, subregular formal languages, transductions with logic and automata, algorithmic learning, and phonological phenomena (harmony, stress, optionality, and more). It is more of an informal forum than organized talks, and open to everyone! A schedule can be found here.

Hope to see you there!

entry.title: Thomas presenting top-down recognition of syntactic constraints
entry.summary: Hi all! This week (April 5) Thomas will be talking about top-down recognition of syntactic constraints. Hope to see you there!
entry.content: Hi all! This week (April 5) Thomas will be talking about top-down recognition of syntactic constraints. Hope to see you there!

entry.title: Gary presenting a computational perspective on the philosophy of mathematics
entry.summary:
Hello all, welcome back! :)

This week (March 29), Gary will be presenting --

A Computational Perspective on the Philosophy of Mathematics: Gödel's Creative Platonism versus Turing's Mechanistic Computationalism?

Hope to see you there!
entry.content:
Hello all, welcome back! :)

This week (March 29), Gary will be presenting --

A Computational Perspective on the Philosophy of Mathematics: Gödel's Creative Platonism versus Turing's Mechanistic Computationalism?

Hope to see you there!
